WRITING.TITLE: Lost all my gear...
WRITING.TEXT: What the hell, yesterday I logged out when I was in a building and today I logged in with absolutely no gear, no pants, no backpack, no shoes, nothing, except my main gun without any attachements. This isn't some kind of prank because I play on servers with no people, So I have no idea what the hell just happened...
Strange, I've logged in today and it said "I have hypothermia', then after running for a few minutes I drank water and ate some food until I was full and now I have healthy status. Interesting haha.

I have orange "sick" status on me, but apart from that I don't get any notifications about sickness in bottom left.

WRITING.TITLE: Sickness doesn't go away
WRITING.TEXT: My best guess would be that I got the sickness from smoke grenade?? because right after I've thrown it, it said my mouth tastes funny. So now I've tried charcoal tabs, antibiotics, vitamins, nothing works I've eaten like dozens of them, I'm not starving I'm always energized and hydrated. Is my sickness bugged?
I figured it out now, I just didn't check clothing. I'm full now lol.

WRITING.TITLE: Sometimes the DayZ would freeze so badly
WRITING.TEXT: That even alt+tab, alt+f4, ctrl+alt+del, restart button doesn't work, nothing works except just plugging the cord out. Has this happened to any of you guys? I have experienced this 4 times through 15 hours of playing. Even the sound freezes lol.
Really informative. Thanks guys!
Also, does open doors necessarily mean that someone's been there? because I see more open doors now than last time I played, so I was thinking maybe this is a new feature in the game.
Oh, that makes sense, because last time I played there was canned food everywhere and now I just see empty house after empty house..

WRITING.TITLE: Something's wrong with food loot?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi people, I'm a returning player from a year ago and I noticed that there's so little food in buildings that I'm constantly hungry or starving. I know all the cities on the shore are pretty looted, but I've been to novy, stary sobor, vybor, zelenogorsk and the houses are just empty, the main food source right now are apples and water from the pond haha. I played 10 hours now and have found few canned tunas, 1 can sardines and 1 canned peaches. What the hell? I've been to lots of servers, everywhere is the same..
Wednesday.
Which [option](https://i.imgur.com/lBTCilm.jpg) should I try?

I have 144Hz monitor, I've tried in-game v-sync, don't think I have noticed much difference, if any at all. I will try changing settings in nvidia control panel once the servers are done with maintenance.

WRITING.TITLE: What very common activity haven't you tried yet?

WRITING.TEXT: [Finished photo](https://i.imgur.com/suZnNuT.jpg)
nice

Also this is not a full list of cars. If you want to find what car in real life represents a certain model in the game, just type car model in google and add gta v to it, wiki link should be first result and you can find the information about that model there. For example "vacca gta v" http://gta.wikia.com/wiki/Vacca The Vacca's design is a mix between the Lamborghini Gallardo for the greenhouse area and the front fascia and the Lamborghini Aventador
Thanks. That's what I'm gonna do from now on.

I reinstalled the game and now I won't install that 160 car pack. I'm now doing cars 1 by 1. You want the car to Be as close as possible.
I use [this](http://www.carscoops.com/2014/02/check-out-50-gta-v-cars-and-their-real.html) for reference and I haven't ran into problems since. And let's just say that the updates are not a problem for me :p
It's godly.

WRITING.TITLE: Which PSU to choose?
WRITING.TEXT:
Here's my soon to be build.
[PCPartPicker part list](http://pcpartpicker.com/list/GTjMZ8) / [Price breakdown by merchant](http://pcpartpicker.com/list/GTjMZ8/by_merchant/)
Type|Item|Price :----|:----|:---- **CPU** | [Intel Core i5-6600K 3.5GHz Quad-Core Processor](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/gx648d/intel-cpu-bx80662i56600k) | $229.99 @ Amazon **CPU Cooler** | [Cooler Master Hyper 212X 82.9 CFM CPU Cooler](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/PJYXsY/cooler-master-cpu-cooler-rr212x20pmr1) | $39.99 @ Newegg **Motherboard** | [Gigabyte GA-Z170-Gaming K3 ATX LGA1151 Motherboard](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/k2mxFT/gigabyte-motherboard-gaz170gamingk3) | $149.99 @ SuperBiiz **Memory** | [Kingston FURY 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR4-2666 Memory](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/JXvZxr/kingston-memory-hx426c15fbk28) | $47.99 @ Amazon **Storage** | [Samsung 850 EVO-Series 250GB 2.5" Solid State Drive](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/3kL7YJ/samsung-internal-hard-drive-mz75e250bam) | $92.00 @ Amazon **Storage** | [Western Digital Caviar Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/MwW9TW/western-digital-internal-hard-drive-wd10ezex) | $47.49 @ OutletPC **Video Card** | [MSI GeForce GTX 1070 8GB Video Card](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/fKp323/msi-geforce-gtx-1070-8gb-video-card-gtx-1070-gaming-x-8g) | $459.99 @ B H **Case** | [Fractal Design Core 2500 ATX Mid Tower Case](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/wZx9TW/fractal-design-case-fdcacore2500bl) | $55.99 @ Directron | *Prices include shipping, taxes, rebates, and discounts* | | **Total** | **$1123.43** | Generated by [PCPartPicker](http://pcpartpicker.com) 2016-07-17 14:18 EDT-0400 |
I've been suggested several times to pick [this](https://seasonic.com/product/m12ii-520-evo/) PSU, but I'm worried that I won't have enough room for a moderate overclock of my system. The other option for me would be the PSU I had picked in the beginning. [Corsair](http://www.corsair.com/en/vs-seriestm-vs650-650-watt-power-supply). Or I just could pick a seasonic 620w, but non-modular, so it would be the same price as 520w modular. What do you think?
P.S. pcpartpicker prices are irrelevant to me.
How do you create those transitions between objects? Is there a tutorial somewhere?

WRITING.TITLE: Which Motherboard to choose?
WRITING.TEXT:
So this is basically what I will be putting in my system, except I still haven't decided what motherboard should I pick. Many people have suggested me different models and brands and I just don't know which side to go for. So far these are the motherboards that have been suggested and ones that I would like to pick.
[Gigabyte GA-Z170-HD3P](https://pcpartpicker.com/product/mp8H99/gigabyte-motherboard-gaz170hd3p) [Gigabyte GA-Z170-Gaming K3](https://pcpartpicker.com/product/k2mxFT/gigabyte-motherboard-gaz170gamingk3) [ASRock Fatal1ty Z170 Gaming K4](https://pcpartpicker.com/product/GYH48d/asrock-motherboard-fatal1tyz170gamingk4) Build:
Type|Item|Price :----|:----|:---- **CPU** | [\*Intel Core i5-6600K 3.5GHz Quad-Core Processor](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/gx648d/intel-cpu-bx80662i56600k) | $238.99 @ SuperBiiz **CPU Cooler** | [Cooler Master Hyper 212X 82.9 CFM CPU Cooler](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/PJYXsY/cooler-master-cpu-cooler-rr212x20pmr1) | $39.99 @ Newegg **Memory** | [Kingston FURY 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR4-2666 Memory](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/JXvZxr/kingston-memory-hx426c15fbk28) | $47.99 @ Amazon **Storage** | [Samsung 850 EVO-Series 250GB 2.5" Solid State Drive](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/3kL7YJ/samsung-internal-hard-drive-mz75e250bam) | $89.99 @ NCIX US **Storage** | [Western Digital Caviar Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/MwW9TW/western-digital-internal-hard-drive-wd10ezex) | $47.49 @ OutletPC **Video Card** | [MSI GeForce GTX 1070 8GB Video Card](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/NJM323/msi-geforce-gtx-1070-8gb-video-card-geforce-gtx-1070-armor-8g-oc) | $429.99 @ SuperBiiz **Case** | [Fractal Design Core 2500 ATX Mid Tower Case](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/wZx9TW/fractal-design-case-fdcacore2500bl) | $55.99 @ Directron **Power Supply** | [SeaSonic 520W 80+ Bronze Certified Fully-Modular ATX Power Supply](http://pcpartpicker.com/product/TgW9TW/seasonic-power-supply-m12ii520bronze) | $65.99 @ SuperBiiz | *Prices include shipping, taxes, rebates, and discounts* | | **Total** | **$1016.42** | \*Lowest price parts chosen from parametric criteria | | Generated by [PCPartPicker](http://pcpartpicker.com) 2016-07-11 09:10 EDT-0400 |
